column2:
Life end of the Ink Tube
 The number of Carriage movement cycles reached the specified upper limit.
Replace the ink tube and CR Motor, and clear the counter using the Adjustment Program.

Carriage home position detection error
 The printer cannot detect the Carriage home position
Check the connection of the CR HP Sensor. Check the installing position of the CR HP Sensor. Replace the HP Sensor. Check if the carriage lock functions.

The CR Motor in position time-out error
 The CR Motor cannot be driven normally. (the carriage movement is not finished.)
Clean the CR Scale. Replace the CR Motor. Replace the CR HP Sensor.

CR Encoder check error
 The CR Encoder signals have a defect.
Check the connection of the CR HP Sensor. Check the connection of the CR Motor. Replace the CR Motor.

CR Motor Step-out error
 CR Motor is out of step.
Clean the CR Scale. Replace the CR Motor. Check the connection of the CR HP Sensor. Check the installing position of the CR HP Sensor.

CR servo parameter error
 The Carriage Unit is overloaded abnormally.
Check if there is any foreign material at the driven section of the Carriage Unit. Replace the CR Motor.

PF Encoder check error
 The PF Encoder signals have a defect.
Check the connection of the PF Encoder. Check the connection of the PF Motor. Replace the PF Motor.

The PF Motor in position time-out error
 The PF Motor cannot be driven normally. (the carriage movement is not finished.)
Clean the PF Scale. Replace the PF Motor. Replace the PF Scale.

PF Motor Step-out error
 PF Motor is out of step.
Clean the PF Scale. Replace the PF Motor. Check the connection of the PF Encoder. Check the installing position of the PF Encoder. Replace the PF Encoder.

PF servo parameter error
 The PF Motor is overloaded abnormally.
Check if there is any foreign material at the driven section of the PF Motor. Replace the PF Motor.

Head driver (transmission gate) overheat error
 The temperature of the Head Driver rises, and reaches the specified level.
Check the connection of the Head FFC, and if there is abnormality (slant connection or the like), correct it. Replace the Printhead.

Pressure failure error
 The Pressure Sensor does not react even the pressurizing continues for the specified period of time.
Check the connection of the Pressure Pump Unit. Check the connection of the Pressure Tubes. Replace the Pressure Pump Unit (Pressure Motor, Pressure Sensor).

Pump motor drive timeover error
 The motor driving does not end even after the specified period of time has passed.
Install the latest firmware. Replace the Main Board Assy.

Cartridge Holder Maintenance
 The life of the waste ink pad for the leakage of the Ink Cartridge replacement has reached its limit. (the life is controlled by counting the times of replacing the cartridges.)
Replace the Ink Cartridge Holder and clear the counter using the Adjustment Program.

Ink cover unlock error
 The Ink Cover cannot be opened.

If there is an obstacle in front of the cover, remove it. Check if the Ink Cover is installed properly. Check the solenoid that locks the Ink Cover and the sensor that detects the open/closed status of the Ink Cover.

Cap HP detection error
 The home position of the Cap Unit cannot be detected.
Check the connection of the Ink System Unit. Replace the Ink System Unit.

Select valve HP detection error
 The home position of the Pump Unit cannot be detected.
Check the connection of the Ink System Unit. Replace the Ink System Unit.

Cap motor drive timeover error
 The motor driving does not end even after the specified period of time has passed.
Install the latest firmware. Replace the Main Board Assy.

Pressure motor 1 acceleration error
 The revolution of the Pressure Motor does not reach the specified speed within the specified period of time.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 2 acceleration error
 The revolution of the Pressure Motor does not reach the specified speed within the specified period of time.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 3 acceleration error
 The revolution of the Pressure Motor does not reach the specified speed within the specified period of time.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 1 lock error
 The revolving speed of the Pressure Motor has decreased.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 2 lock error
 The revolving speed of the Pressure Motor has decreased.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 3 lock error
 The revolving speed of the Pressure Motor has decreased.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 1 reverse detection error
 Abnormality of the revolution of the Pressure Motor has been detected.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 2 reverse detection error
 Abnormality of the revolution of the Pressure Motor has been detected.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Pressure motor 3 reverse detection error
 Abnormality of the revolution of the Pressure Motor has been detected.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

PG HP detection error
 The home position of the platen gap cannot be detected.
Check the connection of the PG Sensor. Replace the PG Sensor. Replace the PG Sensor.

APG motor drive timeover error
 The motor driving does not end even after the specified period of time has passed.
Install the latest firmware. Replace the Main Board Assy.

Pressurizing reset failure
 The pressurizing cannot be reset. The Pressure Sensor remains on, even after the pressurizing has been reset.
Replace the Pressure Pump Unit.

Cap unit status error 1
 The position of the Cap Unit is wrong.
Replace the Ink System Unit (Cap Unit HP Sensor). Replace the Ink System Motor.

Cap unit status error 2
 The position of the Cap Unit is wrong.
Replace the Ink System Unit (Cap Unit HP Sensor). Replace the Ink System Motor.

Cap HP detection retry error
 The Cap Unit HP sensor does not work normally.
Replace the Ink System Unit (Cap Unit HP Sensor).

Print position error
 The correct print position cannot be detected.
Clean the CR Scale. Clean the CR Encoder. Replace the CR Scale. Replace the CR Encoder Sensor. Install the latest firmware.

AID voltage error
 Due to the leak of AID current, the specified voltage cannot be achieved.
Clean the Flushing Box. (Thereâ€™s a possibility of leaking through dust or accumulating ink) Replace the AID Board (BOARD ASSY.,HEAD).

RTC analysis error
 The value information on various absolute time stored on NVRAM is abnormal.
Check if the lithium battery is installed properly. Replace the Main Board Assy.

RTC communication error
 The RTC circuit on the Main Board Assy malfunctions.

Turn the power Off and remove the lithium battery. After a several seconds, reattach the battery and turn the power back On. If the printer recovers from the error, reset the RTC using the Adjustment Program and set the correct date and time

Head thermistor error
 There is a defective connection of the Head FFC. The Head Thermistor detects a temperature out of the specification. The Head Thermistor has a defect.
Check the connection of the Head FFC, and if there is abnormality (slant connection, disconnection or the like). Replace the Printhead.

Transistor thermistor error
 The transistor has a defect. The thermistor detects a temperature out of the specification.
Replace the Printhead.

Head error
 The active signal of Head error has been detected.
Replace the Printhead.

Main board IC2 error
 The destination is wrong.
Configure the destination again.

Head rank ID input error
 The information of the Head rank ID is wrong.
Configure the Head rank ID again.

NVRAM error
 NVRAM erase or write error has occurred.
Replace the Main Board Assy.

SDRAM error
 SDRAM read/write error has occurred.
Replace the Main Board Assy.

BOOT program sum error
 Installation of the firmware has been failed. The Flash ROM has a defect.
Install the firmware again. Replace the Main Board Assy.

Program loading error
 The SDRAM has a defect. The program cannot be loaded on the SDRAM.
Replace the Main Board Assy.

Internal insufficient memory error
 The firmware has a defect.
Install the correct firmware.

Servo interrupt watchdog time-out error
 The servo cannot be controlled.
Install the correct firmware. Replace the Main Board Assy.

System interrupt watchdog time-out error
 A system failure such as CPU failure, defective cash or the like has occurred.
Replace the Main Board Assy.

Unknown NMI
 The CPU has detected an unknown NMI.
Replace the Main Board Assy.

AC power shut-off
 The AC power has been shut off due to a power failure, unplugged, power supply board failure, or main board failure or the like.
Check the connection of the AC cable, and if there is a defect, correct it. Replace the Power Supply Board Assy. Replace the Main Board Assy.
FXXX

CPU-related error
 The firmware has a defect. The Main Board Assy is broken.
Install the correct firmware. Replace the Main Board Assy.
